title: Project Director
content:
Media.Monks London is looking for a super star Project Director to lead multiple projects, workstreams and campaigns for iconic brands. Your well-rounded experience in the trenches allows you to accurately scope, quote, upsell and set up new projects comfortably, whilst actively steering client teams and mentoring your team. You understand the differences between creative, adaptation and technical solutions, and know how to drive operational excellence, with incredible attention to detail.
In this role you will:

As an Project Director at Media.Monks, you’ll work with clients and internal teams from the initial pitch through to plotting the solution and delivering award winning work on budget and on time that everyone loves. 
You’re a project’s pace and peacemaker, and principally responsible for its timely-and-terrific delivery.
Your role is to bring all of our in-house talent together, integrating activities between different disciplines to make sure great work is done across the network, and our production hubs eg. Social, UX, UI, design/animation, Experiential & Tech.
You work side by side with your business counterparts to keep your clients happy, ensuring we are offering world class solutions and being pro-active and purposeful in our delivery. You will build close-knit and trusted working relationships with clients, external agencies and internal teams.
As well as directing London projects, you’ll be expected to manage a growing team of super-star delivery experts. Working directly with the London management team to make sure Media.Monks stays on the roadmap to success.
You will be a precise forecaster and plan resources with great responsibility. 
You are accountable for requirements gathering and developing the scope which includes - budgets, timing and production strategy. You will be very detail oriented and have a hands-on approach to all aspects of your projects. 
You will contribute to presentation and decks, and proactively flag opportunities to upsell services or increase scope of work.
Brief legal, production and language & culture teams. Ensuring the team is clear on specs, deadlines, scope, and any client or local market requirements.
Key point of contact for local client teams: you understand business KPIs and drive meetings, overall communications, and successful client relationships. You are the first point of contact for client escalations.
You run several medium to large parallel projects independently, graciously steering clients and internal teams from end-to-end across multiple workstreams.

 
Requirements:

We are looking for a seasoned Delivery lead with 10+ years of experience managing a portfolio of brands
You are experienced in stakeholder managements with tier one clients, who will seek your take, expertise and leadership on the production/delivery strategy
Strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills
Incredible attention to detail
Can lead negotiations in partnership with the client services team, particular focus on procurement and financial management
Have a background in integrated production across multichannel such as Digital campaign, social, platform implementation, film production, and nice to have on data integration.
Experience in end-to-end timeline of a project from client briefing to delivery. Is able to successfully navigate the balance between creative ambition and pragmatic delivery.
Identify and document specific ways of working and processes particular for your client, and internal teams. And be the driving force to implement them.
Must have the know-how to speak to original productions, and the producer team to devise an approach during these phases. 
Strong awareness and proven experience in line management, cultivating a team of PM’s and producers to create a healthy working environment, whilst delivering best in class work.
Experience in working within a network to grow relationships between offices and capabilities and seek out the best skill sets for your portfolio
About Media.Monks:
Media.Monks is the purely digital operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 8,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-22), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-23), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-23), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth.
While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.
Disclaimer: 


Responsible for resourcing and implementing security controls for your teams processes and systems


Responsible that all your personnel apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy

We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission.
